business.headline: RBI makes PRAVAAH portal mandatory for financial institutions starting May 1The PRAVAAH portal provides all necessary forms, along with simple instructions. Users can submit their application, track its progress, and even get alerts.
GST collections hit record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, up 12.6%In March, GST collections stood at Rs 1.96 lakh crore, showing a 9.9% rise from the same period last year.

Nithin Kamath exposes this scam using his name to dupe investors. Details hereZerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has urged investors to stay alert, always check the source, and never act on random financial advice sent on messaging apps.

Adani Ports Q4 results: Net profit soars 50%, revenue up 23%The company reported a 50% rise in its consolidated net profit, which stood at Rs 3,023 crore. This is an increase from Rs 2,025 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.
Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 46.14 points to end at 80,242.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 1.75 points to close at 24,334.20.

Can gold retain its glitter as Dalal Street gets back its glow?Just a week ago, gold was trading at record levels due to global uncertainty. Concerns over trade tensions, US tariffs, and geopolitical issues had pushed investors towards gold, a common choice during uncertain times.

New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

RBI raises ATM charges to Rs 23 from May 1: Know the details herePeople living in metro cities would get three free transactions per month, while those living in non-metro areas would get five free transactions per month.

Rupee jumps to highest level in 2025. Check factors behind strong rallyThe Indian rupee reached its highest level of 2025, driven by foreign inflows and exporter dollar sales. Optimism over US-India trade talks and a weakening US dollar further supported the currency's rally.

'If we look closely...': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu on finding rural talentZoho's CEO, Sridhar Vembu, believes that India's path to development must include creating jobs and opportunities in smaller towns and villages.

5 Adani stocks get new targets after Q4 results: What should investors do?With Gautam Adani-led Adani Enterprises Ltd set to announce its earnings report soon, stock brokerages have already reviewed the performance of five listed companies from the group and shared fresh price targets and advice for investors.

Varun Beverages Q4 net profit at Rs 726 crore; firm announces interim dividendThe company posted a net profit of Rs 726 crore, up 35% year-on-year, driven by higher volumes and peak-season demand. Revenue for the quarter came in at Rs 5,680 crore, a 29% jump YoY, slightly ahead of most analyst estimates.

Vivad Se Vishwas 2.0 deadline ends today: Last call to settle income tax disputesVivad Se Vishwas 2.0 is a dispute resolution scheme run by the Income Tax Department. It gives taxpayers a chance to settle ongoing tax-related cases by avoiding the prolonged litigation process and simply paying the disputed tax amount.

Akshaya Tritiya 2025: Is falling gold price an opportunity to buy more?Akshaya Tritiya is considered a good day to buy gold. But with gold prices now close to all-time highs, near Rs 96,000 per 10 grams, many buyers are thinking twice before making big purchases this year.
Ather Energy IPO ends today: Should you subscribe or avoid?Ather Energy is struggling to generate investor interest, with sluggish IPO subscription levels and a muted grey market premium.

Bajaj Finance shares tank over 5% after Q4 results. Buy, hold or sell?The stock reacted to a set of numbers that, while solid on paper, failed to match elevated market expectations. In the fourth quarter of FY25, Bajaj Finance reported a 19% year-on-year jump in net profit to Rs 4,546 crore, driven by a 22% rise in net interest income to Rs 9,807 crore.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finserv shares tumbled 6% after Q4 resultsIn its Q4FY25 earnings, Bajaj Finserv reported a 14% year-on-year (YoY) rise in both net profit and revenue, posting Rs 2,417 crore in profit and Rs 36,595 crore in revenue.

Gold price falls further as easing trade tensions dampen appealSpot gold was down 0.2% at $3,308.32 an ounce, as of 0242 GMT. US gold futures GCcv1 lost 0.5% to $3,317.50. The dollar edged 0.1% higher against a basket of currencies, making bullion more expensive for overseas buyers.

IndusInd Bank share price falls nearly 3% after CEO resignsSumant Kathpalia's resignation marks a dramatic turn in the bank's ongoing troubles related to internal derivatives trades that were improperly accounted for, raising questions about internal oversight and risk management.
Sensex, Nifty recover early losses as FII inflows lift market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex added 83.58 points to 80,371.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 18.70 points to 24,354.65 as of 9:45 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock markets to rise or fall today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,323.5 at 8:10 am. This suggests that Nifty50 will likely start the day close to Tuesday's closing level of 24,335.95.

Stocks to watch on April 30: Infosys, IndusInd Bank, Adani Power, Ola ElectricThough there were worries about border tensions with Pakistan that weighed on investor sentiment, foreign investors continued to buy Indian shares, and global markets gave positive signals.
Mother Dairy raises milk prices by up to Rs 2 per litreThe price revision will be effective from April 30, 2025 across its market, a company official said on Tuesday.

IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia resigns after derivatives accounting lapseThe accounting lapse, which pertained to internal derivative trades, had a negative impact on the bank's profit and loss statement and its net worth. In his resignation letter, Kathpalia wrote, "I undertake moral responsibility, given the various acts of commission/omission that have been brought to my notice."

Tata plant begins iPhone production in India as Apple pivots from tariff-hit ChinaThe new Tata facility in Hosur, southern India, has begun rolling out older iPhone models on a single production line. Meanwhile, Foxconn's upcoming $2.6 billion factory in Karnataka's capital is expected to start trial production of the iPhone 16 series shortly, sources told the news agency.

Osamu Suzuki conferred with Padma Vibhushan for contribution to auto industryOsamu Suzuki, former Chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation and ex-Director & Honorary Chairman of Maruti Suzuki India Limited, was posthumously honoured with the Padma Vibhushan, the country's second-highest civilian award.

Sensex, Nifty close flat after volatile trade as border tensions weigh on marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 70 points to close at 80,288.38, while the NSE Nifty50 just managed to end in green, adding 7.45 points to close at 24,335.95.

entertainment.headline: Shah Rukh Khan weighs in on insider vs outsider debate: I have a problemShah Rukh Khan recently weighed in on the insider vs outsider debate at the WAVES Summit 2025. The actor mentioned how he has a problem with the distinction.

K-pop star Jackson Wang teams up with Diljit Dosanjh for new singleInternational pop star Jackson Wang and Indian music icon Diljit Dosanjh have joined forces for a new single. Titled 'BUCK', it is set to release on May 9.

Virat Kohli's birthday wish for his 'best half' Anushka Sharma is all things loveCricketer Virat Kohli wished his actor-wife Anushka Sharma with an adorable post on social media. He shared a beautiful picture of the couple on the special day.

Sonu Nigam brings up 'Pahalgam' during concert, feels 'threatened' by Kannada fanSinger Sonu Nigam was performing in Bengaluru when a fan started screaming, demanding a Kannada song. The singer paused the concert, addressed the incident, and also mentioned the ghastly Pahalgam terror attack.

HIT 3 review: Nani's film has its moments, but it's more a miss than a hitReleased-Thu May 01, 2025'HIT: The Third Case' is the third instalment from the successful HIT universe created by director Sailesh Kolanu. The film stars Telugu actor Nani and Srinidhi Shetty of KGF fame in the lead. The third part of the franchise has scaled up considerably and attempts to gain more mass appeal, but does it work?

Salman Khan in talks to play Army Officer in film on 2020 Galwan Valley clash?Bollywood superstar Salman Khan is in talks to star as an Indian Army officer in a war drama about the 2020 Galwan Valley clash. The film will be based on the book, India's Most Fearless 3, and will be directed by Apoorva Lakhia.

Retro review: Suriya's overstuffed film stumbles between eras and ideasReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Retro movie review: Director Karthik Subbaraj's 'Retro', starring Suriya, Joju George and Pooja Hegde, is an overstuffed love story with a gangster backdrop. While the film begins on a spectacular note, it fizzles as it progresses.
Singer Shaan, Rakhi Gulzar's emotional interaction at event. WatchSinger Shaan recently got emotional after he met veteran actor Rakhi Gulzar. A video from their heartfelt interaction has gone viral.

HIT 3 X review: Audience calls Nani's film sensational and stylish, see postsHIT 3 X movie review: Nani's action entertainer has made the audience go bonkers on social media. Several viewers like the actor's style, and the ruthless cop avatar in the third film from the franchise.

Shanaya Kapoor's Ankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan to be monsoon entertainer, release date outShanaya Kapoor is all set to make her Bollywood debut alongside Vikrant Massey in the romantic film, 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan', releasing on July 11th, 2025. The motion poster was released earlier this year.

Exclusive: Lewis Pullman, Hannah John-Kamen call Thunderbolts 'indie' Marvel filmMarvel Studios' 'Thunderbolts' is set to be an emotionally deep and grounded film in the MCU, exploring the psychological depths of anti-heroes and villains. Directed by Jake Schreier, the film features a unique tone and aims to resonate deeply with the audience.

Tom Cruise pilots helicopter to fly rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas to LondonHollywood superstar Tom Cruise personally flew Ana de Armas to London for her 37th birthday. The videos shared online seemingly confirmed their relationship.

The Bhootnii review: A virgin tree, love curse, and lot of nonsenseReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In the film 'The Bhootnii', Sanjay Dutt and Sunny Singh deliver a lackluster performance in a horror-comedy that fails to amuse or engage audiences. Despite its attempt at blending romance and supernatural elements, the film ends up as an uninspired two-hour ordeal.

PM Modi will bring peace in Kashmir: Rajinikanth at WAVES Summit 2025Superstar Rajinikanth thanked PM Narendra Modi during his speech at the WAVES Summit 2025. He also mentioned the Pahalgam terrorist attack, and said he trusts the Prime Minister to restore glory and peace in the Valley.

Neha Kakkar shares post after fresh claims emerge in Melbourne concert controversyNeha Kakkar made a fresh post amid fresh claims from the organisers of her Melbourne concert. The singer supported her brother Tony Kakkar's new song, but wrote something which appeared a little cryptic. The post comes amid ongoing allegations that she lied about the reasons behind delays at the event.

Exclusive: Girl group W.i.S.H wants to collaborate with Jungkook, Dua LipaW.i.S.H, India's first girl group in 22 years, is making waves with their unique blend of Indian and global music styles, aiming to carve out a space in the international pop scene. The band discusses their journey, challenges, and aspirations in an exclusive interview

Deepika-Ranveer have a 'good time' at dinner with Instagram Head Adam MosseriPower couple Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh stepped out for a dinner night with Instagram head Adam Mosseri in Mumbai last night. Adam also shared a post featuring the couple expressing gratitude.

Chhaava actor Viineet Kumar Singh to welcome first child with wife RuchiraActor Viineet Kumar Singh, popular for his roles in 'Chhaava' and 'Superboys of Malegaon', is all set to welcome his first child with wife Ruchira Singh.

Raid 2 movie review: Ajay Devgn's film crumbles under weight of his stardomReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In 'Raid 2', you never get to meet Amay Patnaik, the honest income tax officer, because Ajay Devgn never gives in to the character. He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

general news.headline: 'Chun chun ke badla': Amit Shah vows revenge in first remarks on J&K attackIn his first public remarks on Pahalgam attack, Amit Shah reiterated his government's commitment to uproot terrorism from every corner of the country.

Iss baar ghar mein ghus ke baith jaana: Asaduddin Owaisi's POK tip to governmentAIMIM chief and Lok Sabha MP Asaduddin Owaisi told BJP that instead of "ghar me ghus ke maarenge", the Indian government should take action and just take Pakistan-occupied Kashmir back.

As India-Pak tensions reach fever pitch, diplomatic channels on overdriveDiplomatic channels have gone on overdrive in the past few days to avoid a full-blown confrontation between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack.

MP flags OTT show showing sex positions days after Centre's 'perversity' remark'Contestants mimicking sex position on Ullu App's "House Arrest" show hosted by Ajaz Khan has triggered a massive online outrage, drawing political attention and fresh scrutiny of OTT content regulation.

BJP's hostile takeover of Rahul's caste census card signals a new political pitchThose expecting a surgical strike on Pakistan instead got a decision that was projected as a surgical strike on the Congress, which has been at the forefront demanding a caste census.

Don't demoralise forces: Supreme Court refuses to hear Pahalgam attack pleaThe petition sought the formation of a judicial commission to investigate the terror attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran valley that left 26 dead.

No CBSE Classes 10, 12 Result 2025 tomorrow, board dismisses false claimsCBSE has confirmed that the Class 10 and 12 board results will not be declared tomorrow, dismissing circulating rumours. The official result date is yet to be announced, and students are advised to rely only on the board's websites for updates.

Pahalgam massacre: How India can make Pakistan payWhat the government can do next as the pain of the Pahalgam terror attack resonates in the cries of defining punishment for the perpetrators and their backers

Indian designer Rahul Mishra's Hollywood wave: Blake Lively stuns in 3D skirtHollywood sensation Blake Lively looked stunning as she stepped out wearing a 3D black pencil skirt by Indian designer Rahul Mishra for the promotions of her upcoming move.

CRPF jawan's Pakistani wife on deportation bus gets last-minute reliefMinal Khan from Pakistan's Punjab met and married a CRPF jawan from India online. She came to Jammu on a short-term visa, which expired on March 22. Minal was among the Pakistanis asked to leave after the Pahalgam terror attack, but won a last-minute court reprieve. The case has raised eyebrows.

Raid 2 movie review: Ajay Devgn's film crumbles under weight of his stardomReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In 'Raid 2', you never get to meet Amay Patnaik, the honest income tax officer, because Ajay Devgn never gives in to the character. He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

Pahalgam attackers likely hiding in south Kashmir, self-reliant, say NIA sourcesSources said that during the attack on April 22 in Pahalgam's Baisaran valley, there were suspicions of additional terrorists maintaining a distance, possibly to provide cover-fire in case security forces attempted a rapid response.

Watch: Chinese man uses martial arts to stop thief trying to steal his cameraThe incident, which was caught on camera by pedestrians, shows the man using a neck choke hold to restrain the thief until police arrived.

Fresh deportation fear among international students in US after ICE memoMany international students are feeling the jitters again in the US after Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) issued an internal memo after recently reinstating the SEVIS record. The new memo states that students can now face issue if they have a gap in their records. This power has previously been denied to ICE.

The politics of caste census and who benefits from knowing your 'jaati'Amid tensions between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam attack, the government took everyone by surprise by announcing that caste enumeration would be part of the next census exercise - a persistent demand of the opposition. In this edition of The Lowdown, we dive deep into India's caste history, past instances of such surveys and the political signalling it gives.

Pakistan's aviation industry is so dead it doesn't feel India's airspace banHow would Indian airspace ban impact Pakistani flights, many ask. Short answer: Pakistan has no aviation industry, so to speak.

Virat Kohli's birthday wish for his 'best half' Anushka Sharma is all things loveCricketer Virat Kohli wished his actor-wife Anushka Sharma with an adorable post on social media. He shared a beautiful picture of the couple on the special day.

Man born in PoK approaches Supreme Court after family asked to leave IndiaThe petitioner said he and his family, including his parents, sister, and younger brother, are Indian citizens and hold valid Indian passports issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs.

Won't get even 5 minutes to escape: Islamists warn Bangladesh govtIn what reveals the power and confidence gained by Islamists in Bangladesh, several Islamic hardline parties have warned the Muhammed Yunus-led interim government against implementing the proposals of a women's reforms commission. One of the Islamist groups said the leaders wouldn't get even "five minutes to escape", an allusion to the 45 minutes that Sheikh Hasina got to leave Bangladesh.

Terrorists recced 3 Pahalgam spots, tight security foiled attack at park: SourcesA week before the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, mostly tourists, on April 22, terrorists had conducted reconnaissance of three locations in the area on April 15, sources said.
Fart walks: Doctor-approved fitness trend for healthy ageingTaking short walks after meals can help with digestion and keep your blood sugar levels in check.

India deploys jammers to block Pakistan aircraft navigation systems: SourcesThe Indian jamming systems are capable of interfering with multiple satellite-based navigation platforms, including GPS (US), GLONASS (Russia), and Beidou (China)-all of which are used by Pakistani military craft, sources said.

HIT 3 review: Nani's film has its moments, but it's more a miss than a hitReleased-Thu May 01, 2025'HIT: The Third Case' is the third instalment from the successful HIT universe created by director Sailesh Kolanu. The film stars Telugu actor Nani and Srinidhi Shetty of KGF fame in the lead. The third part of the franchise has scaled up considerably and attempts to gain more mass appeal, but does it work?

What is Apple vs Epic battle and what about Fortnite? All of it explainedIn the ongoing legal battle between Apple and Epic Games over App Store rules, the latter has scored a big win. The US court has ruled that Apple is no longer allowed to collect fees on purchases made outside apps or restrict developers from redirecting users to where they can make purchases outside of apps.

sports.headline: Virender Sehwag reveals why Delhi didn't pick Virat Kohli in IPL 2008Former India cricketer and Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) captain Virender Sehwag has revealed the real reason why Delhi didn't choose Virat Kohli in the Under-19 player's draft of the Indian Premier League 2008 (IPL 2008).

Bangladesh should have won the series vs Zimbabwe: Najmul ShantoBangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers should have won the Test series against Zimbabwe. Shanto's Tigers beat the visitors by an innings and 106 runs in Chattogram.

Barely slept the night before: Suryakumar recalls Mumbai Indians debutIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav recalled his IPL debut for the Mumbai Indians back in 2012 against Pune Warriors. The right-handed batter recently completed 4000 runs in the IPL.

Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPAThe All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) has opposed the Sports Ministry's decision to grant National Sports Federation (NSF) status to the Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), calling the move unjustified in a letter dated April 25, 2025.

Suyash thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionsIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.

Punjab Kings star Glenn Maxwell ruled out of IPL 2025 due to finger fracturePunjab Kings' Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season due to a fractured finger.

I'm too stupid to answer that question: Iga Swiatek shuts down journalistFive-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek found herself in an awkward position after a journalist asked her a question in the press conference after her Madrid Open quarterfinal against Madison Keys.

Yuzvendra Chahal explains his IPL hattrick heroics vs CSKAfter taking his second IPL hattrick, Yuzvendra Chahal revealed that he relied on his instincts and tweaked his line during their IPL clash against Chennai Super Kings.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 in England to start on June 12The Women's T20 World Cup 2026 is scheduled to take place from June 12 to July 5. 33 matches will take place across 24 days in seven venues. Lord's will host the grand finale.

Mumbai Indians sign Raghu Sharma as replacement for injured Vignesh PuthurMumbai Indians spinner Vignesh Puthur was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to injury. The MI team management have signed Raghu Sharma as a replacement for the injured Vignesh Puthur.

RR vs MI: Can Rajasthan hamper Mumbai's winning momentum to stay alive?IPL 2025, RR vs MI: Mumbai Indians have a great chance of becoming the table-toppers, while Rajasthan Royals are looking for a win to stay alive in the competition.

Rohit Sharma reveals chat with his parents after Wankhede stadium honourIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he has convinced his parents to come to the Wankhede stadium and watch his match from the stand named after him.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi has changed the momentum for RR, says Riyan ParagRajasthan Royals' interim captain Riyan Parag has lauded 14-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi for his maturity and impact on the squad.

Shreyas Iyer penalised for slow over rate against Chennai Super KingsIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Punjab Kings' skipper Shreyas Iyer was fined Rs 12 lakh of his match fees after the four-wicket win over the Chennai Super Kings on Wednesday at the Chepauk.

Punjab Kings coach explains delay in signing injury replacementsPunjab Kings head coach Ricky Ponting has explained the delay in signing injury replacements, saying that the schedule clash with PSL has limited the availability of quality options. The team has been dealing with key injuries, as Glenn Maxwell fractured his finger during a training session ahead of the rain-abandoned match against Kolkata Knight Riders on April 26, while Lockie Ferguson has been ruled out for the season due to a serious injury.

Watch: Dhoni talks at length with CEO Kasi Viswanathan after early exitIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: MS Dhoni had a chat with Chennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan after the five-time champions failed to qualify for the playoffs following their four-wicket defeat to Punjab Kings.

IPL 2025: CSK bowling coach Eric Simons blames Chennai batters for early exitChennai Super Kings' bowling coach Eric Simons admitted that his team had to improve their batting accuracy after being eliminated from the playoffs by the Punjab Kings. "We have been good at taking wickets, but as a team in our batting, there are a few areas where we need to find and to be more accurate around and what we need to do," Simons said. "It's all about being more accurate."

Trent Boult excited to go up against 'fearless' Vaibhav Suryavanshi in JaipurMumbai Indians fast bowler Trent Boult said he was excited to take on Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the upcoming fixture against the Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Man Singh Stadium, Jaipur.

David Boon retires as ICC match referee after remarkable 14-year stintDavid Boon retired as an ICC match referee on Wednesday, ending a remarkable 14-year tenure. His final assignment was the second Test between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe in Chattogram.

Shreyas Iyer has taken his game to a new level: Ricky PontingIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Ricky Ponting lauded Shreyas Iyer after his match-winning 72 off 41 balls against the Chennai Super Kings took Punjab Kings to second in the points table.

Barcelona fight back to draw six-goal thriller with Inter MilanBarcelona rallied twice to force a 3-3 draw at home against Inter Milan in the thrilling first leg of their Champions League semi-final on Wednesday at Montjuic Olympic Stadium.

5 reasons behind CSK's horrendous IPL 2025 campaignCSK's IPL 2025 campaign unravelled under the weight of outdated tactics, misfired auction moves, and unsteady leadership. With playoff hopes extinguished, the five-time champions are left to confront a season that exposed cracks in their once-unshakeable foundation.

CSK will ponder releasing Ashwin for next season to free up purse: Sanjay BangarFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Bangar feels Chennai Super Kings (CSK) might think about releasing Ravichandran Ashwin for the next season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) to free up some purse.

Pathirana's accuracy not a problem, batters are playing him a lot better: Eric SimonsChennai Super Kings' bowling coach, Eric Simons, defended Matheesha Pathirana following another poor outing against Punjab Kings in Match 49 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Aaron Finch brushes off MS Dhoni's retirement talks, backs him to return in 2026Former Australia cricketer Aaron Finch has backed MS Dhoni to return for another season of the Indian Premier League after Chennai Super Kings (CSK) became the first team to get knocked out of IPL 2025, following four-wicket loss to Punjab Kings (PBKS).

MS Dhoni blames fielding lapses as CSK crash out of playoffs race after PBKS lossMS Dhoni admitted that Chennai Super Kings lacked sharpness in the field, and costly dropped catches combined with inconsistent batting proved decisive in their loss to PBKS — confirming their exit from IPL 2025 playoffs race.

Hapless CSK first team out of playoffs race after home humbling by PBKSIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Chennai Super Kings became the first team to be eliminated from the playoffs race. Despite posting 190 on the board, the five-time champions were hammered by Punjab Kings in a must-win game in Chennai on Wednesday.

RR won't rush Sanju Samson's injury: Rahul Dravid on availability vs MIIPL 2025: Sanju Samson's fitness remains a major concern for Rajasthan Royals, as head coach Rahul Dravid confirms the team will not rush their captain's return, even with IPL 2025 playoff hopes hanging in the balance.

Yuzvendra Chahal reveals meme-inspired reason for hat-trick pose vs CSKIPL 2025: Yuzvendra Chahal drew inspiration from his own viral 2019 meme to celebrate a stunning second IPL hat-trick, which flipped the script for Punjab Kings in their high-stakes clash against Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk.

IPL 2025: Sam Curran hits CSK's top IPL 2025 score, celebrates in fiery styleSam Curran's powerful 88 gave CSK a fighting total and brief hope in a critical clash against Punjab Kings, but Yuzvendra Chahal's late hat-trick brought yet another late-innings collapse for the five-time champions.

CSK vs PBKS: Yuzvendra Chahal 3rd man to take multiple hat-tricks in IPL historyIndia and Punjab Kings' wrist spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took a hat trick against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 49 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
